neighbors.name: Okelley Helen C et al
neighbors.claims: Helen C. Okelley (and family, "et al") is listed as the owner of multiple rural parcels in Lee County ([Lee County Assessor](https://www.qpublic.net/sc/lee/)). Public records indicate a Helen C. Okelley with a registered address in Bishopville ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/o/helen-okelley/sc/bishopville/)). No public statements or media reports were found in which Okelley has taken any position on local development or energy projects, indicating no evident advocacy or opposition ([Lee County Planning](https://leecountyplanning.com/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Aging landowner; low public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Emphasize respect for her family’s long-held land and reassure that the project will preserve the agricultural legacy of the area. A local farmer or trusted community elder could help introduce discussions.

citations.claim: Helen C. Okelley (and family, "et al") is listed as the owner of multiple rural parcels in Lee County
citations.title: Lee County Assessor Public Records

citations.claim: Public records indicate a Helen C. Okelley with a registered address in Bishopville
citations.title: Public Data Directory - Helen Okelley

citations.claim: No public statements or media reports were found in which Okelley has taken any position on local development or energy projects
citations.title: Lee County Planning Commission Minutes Archive

neighbors.name: Kelley L. Wilkes & Chad E. Wilkes
neighbors.claims: Chad E. Wilkes is a prominent local figure in education and athletics. He served as the head football coach at Lamar High School until 2022 and subsequently led Oceanside Collegiate Academy to a state championship in 2023 ([SI High School](https://www.si.com/high-school/south-carolina/west-florence-hires-a-state-championship-winning-head-coach-01jhv5c94vya)). In January 2025, he was hired as the head football coach at West Florence High School ([West Florence HS News](https://westflorence.f1s.org/our-school/archived-news/news-details/~board/west-florence-high-school-news/post/west-florence-high-school-welcomes-chad-wilkes-as-new-varsity-head-football-coach)). He has also been identified as having served as interim police chief of Lamar, SC in 2017 ([News and Press](https://www.newsandpress.net)). The Wilkes family owns a residential parcel in the area, but they have not made any recorded public comments for or against development or clean energy proposals in Lee County ([Lee County Planning](https://leecountyplanning.com/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State championship winning coach; former police chief

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a law enforcement or school community contact who knows them. Emphasize plans for roadway safety during construction and the project’s alignment with community decisions and oversight.

citations.claim: led Oceanside Collegiate Academy to a state championship in 2023
citations.title: West Florence hires a state championship-winning head coach

citations.claim: In January 2025, he was hired as the head football coach at West Florence High School
citations.title: West Florence High School Welcomes Chad Wilkes

citations.claim: identified as having served as interim police chief of Lamar, SC in 2017
citations.title: News and Press Archives (Headline Verification)

citations.claim: they have not made any recorded public comments for or against development or clean energy proposals in Lee County
citations.title: Lee County Planning Commission Minutes Archive

neighbors.name: Craven Walby C & Frank C
neighbors.claims: Walby C. Craven and Frank C. Craven are co-owners of a farming enterprise in the county; Frank C. Craven is listed as the principal of “Craven Farms,” a local crop farming business based in Bishopville ([Dun & Bradstreet](https://www.dnb.com/business-directory/company-profiles.craven_farms.14823a1a7d3478a8f9ca0915d6022692.html)). The farm is an active agricultural operation and a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=45061&progcode=total&regionname=LeeCounty,SouthCarolina)). Despite their prominent role in agriculture, there is no record of either Craven making public statements about area developments or energy projects in news or county meeting records ([News and Press](https://www.newsandpress.net)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major farm owners; long-time locals

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through an agricultural extension or farm bureau connection. Discuss how the project will protect productive farmland (e.g., minimal impact on soil/drainage) and address any concerns about infrastructure like local roads used during construction.

citations.claim: Frank C. Craven is listed as the principal of “Craven Farms,” a local crop farming business based in Bishopville
citations.title: Dun & Bradstreet Business Directory

citations.claim: The farm is an active agricultural operation and a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Lee County SC

citations.claim: there is no record of either Craven making public statements about area developments or energy projects
citations.title: News and Press Archives

neighbors.name: Woodham Carol Jane
neighbors.claims: Carol Jane Woodham is a long-time resident; her family name is notably tied to “Woodham Road” in the area, reflecting a longstanding local presence ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/1605-Woodham-Rd-Bishopville-SC-29010)). Records indicate she is an alumna of Clemson University, class of 1975 ([Clemson Taps 1975](https://archive.org/stream/taps1975clem/taps1975clem_djvu.txt)). She has no known participation in public forums or media regarding development issues, and there are no reported instances of her voicing support or opposition to projects ([The Sumter Item](https://www.theitem.com/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime resident; minimal public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a neighbor she trusts reach out in person. Stress that the project will maintain the peace and quiet of the area and respect the long-time family ownership of surrounding lands.

neighbors.name: E. B. Stuckey Jr.
neighbors.claims: E. B. Stuckey Jr. is a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies in Bishopville, SC ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=45061&progcode=total_cr&page=17)). The Stuckey family is a historically prominent surname in Lee County, with genealogical records and a family cemetery in the area ([SC History](https://schistory.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/Stuckey-genealogical-collection-418.00.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Agricultural subsidy recipient; historically prominent local family name

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a respected local farming community member to acknowledge his family’s ties to the land and address any concerns about land use or legacy.

neighbors.name: John Michael McConnell
neighbors.claims: John Michael McConnell is identified as a resident of Hartsville, SC in the 2025 obituary of his mother, Jacqueline Keys Welborn McConnell ([Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/jackie-mcconnell-obituary?id=59323947)). This location and familial context align with J. Michael McConnell, the former U.S. Director of National Intelligence (DNI) and retired Vice Admiral, who is a South Carolina native and Furman University graduate ([EduRank](https://edurank.org/uni/furman/alumni/)). A subdivision in Hartsville is also named 'John Michael McConnell' ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/SC/Hartsville/3625-N-Center-Rd-29550/home/121979130)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Likely former US Director of National Intelligence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with the assumption that this is a highly prominent individual (former DNI). Use a senior project leader for outreach. Frame the conversation around national security, energy independence, and land stewardship.

neighbors.name: Benjamin J. & Mona S. Chua
neighbors.claims: Benjamin J. Chua passed away on August 1, 2019; he was a U.S. Air Force veteran and employee of Eaton Corporation ([ECS Funeral Home](https://ecsfuneralhome.com/memorials/Chua-Benjamin/3936290)). The property is likely held by his widow, Mona S. Chua. In 2018, the Chuas obtained a permit for a residential roof-mount solar panel system at their Sumter residence, demonstrating a supportive action toward renewable energy technology ([Sumter Item](https://eta.creativecirclecdn.com/sumter/files/20181110-213433-111118.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents; no leadership roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge Mona Chua's prior investment in solar technology as a point of alignment. Ensure outreach is respectful of her widow status and focuses on the project's responsible integration with the local landscape.

neighbors.name: Lottie Mae Williams
neighbors.claims: Lottie Mae Williams (1941–2025) was a resident of Bishopville who passed away on September 6, 2025 ([JP Holley](https://www.jpholley.com/obituaries/lottie-williams)). Public records do not indicate she held public office or was active in development debates prior to her death ([JP Holley](https://www.jpholley.com/obituaries/lottie-williams)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elder resident; no public office

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the estate executor or heirs. Focus on heritage and family legacy, as the property is in transition following Ms. Williams' recent passing.

neighbors.name: Cecil W. Watkins Jr.
neighbors.claims: Cecil W. Watkins Jr. is listed as the owner of a rural Lee County parcel (PIN 024-00-00-047-000) [Lee County GIS](https://www.leecountysc.org/directory/departments___elected_officials/mapping_office.php). The Watkins family has significant local influence; a Ben E. Watkins served on the Lee County Council in the 1990s [Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/south-carolina/supreme-court/1993/23903-2.html), and Alan Watkins currently serves as the Lee County Administrator [Lee County Council Minutes](https://cms9files.revize.com/leecountysc//cc%20min.071123.pdf). Cecil W. Watkins Sr. was a long-time resident and community leader (Jaycee President) prior to his passing [Norton Funeral Home](https://www.nortonfh.net/obituaries/cecil-watkins-sr).
neighbors.influence_justification: Family includes County Administrator and former Councilman

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage family political ties; approach via County Administrator's office or mutual contacts to discuss land legacy and community benefit.

neighbors.influence_justification: Likely absentee or corporate owner; no local roles

A James Edward Tolbert (1957-2024) recently passed away in neighboring Georgia, raising the possibility that this is now heirs' property [Legacy](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/james-tolbert-obituary?id=55144598). No public statements or documented views on development by a living James Tolbert in Lee County were found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify current ownership status (possible estate). Approach heirs with sensitivity, focusing on property value retention and minimal disturbance.

neighbors.name: Warren M. Lee
neighbors.claims: Warren M. Lee is a resident of Lee County and the son of Mary Lucia Lee, a long-time local landowner ([SC DHEC Enforcement Report](https://www.des.sc.gov/sites/des/files/docs/Environment/docs/Enforcement/2011/SeptemberReport.pdf)). In 2011, Lee was the subject of a South Carolina DHEC enforcement order regarding the open dumping of solid waste on family property ([SC DHEC Enforcement Report](https://www.des.sc.gov/sites/des/files/docs/Environment/docs/Enforcement/2011/SeptemberReport.pdf)). There is no public record of him holding elected office or taking a public stance on renewable energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public office; history of environmental non-compliance

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with caution given past regulatory history; emphasize how the project ensures professional land management and compliance with all environmental standards.

neighbors.name: Lewis B. Smith & James E. Smith
neighbors.claims: Lewis B. Smith and James E. Smith are brothers and landowners in the region, identified as the sons of the late Thelma Smith of the Mt. Elon Baptist Church community ([The State Obituary](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thestate/name/thelma-smith-obituary?id=12577517)). Lewis B. Smith has been associated with an address in Florence, SC ([The State Obituary](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thestate/name/thelma-smith-obituary?id=12577517)). They maintain a low public profile with no documented leadership roles or public statements regarding development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners, not publicly active

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths through a neighborly, informal approach (perhaps via a mutual acquaintance at Mt. Elon Baptist Church), focusing on how the development will respect their land and farming heritage.

He appears in local records as a family member of long-time residents, such as Elma Tharp Rooks ([Star-News Obituary](https://www.ncgenweb.us/newhanover/obits/sept2008obits.htm)). No public record exists of him holding civic office or expressing views on land-use planning.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farmer or community elder initiate contact, emphasizing how any project plans respect farmland heritage and the long-term legacy of the land.

neighbors.name: Francine Robinson
neighbors.claims: Francine Robinson (born approx. 1958) is a landowner residing on Dampier Road in Lamar, Lee County ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/r/francine-robinson/)). She is a member of the local Robinson family, with ties to the Hartsville and Lamar communities ([Hines Funeral Home Obituary](https://www.hinesfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Shirley-Thomas?obId=4282437)). There is no evidence of her participation in public zoning hearings or development opposition.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private resident; not publicly active

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a friendly personal visit by a community member she trusts, focusing on preserving the quiet rural character of her land and family legacy.

neighbors.claims: Could not verify the existence of 'Jugs Chicken House Farm LLC' in Lee County, SC public records or business filings. No evidence of a poultry operation under this specific name was found in Lee County agricultural listings or news reports.
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity could not be verified in the target geography; likely a data error or misidentified parcel.

neighbors.claims: Could not verify the existence of 'McLeod-McQuilla Property LLC' in Lee County public records. The Parcel Identification Number (PIN) 025-00-00-055-000 is associated with a property in Marion County, SC, listed in delinquent tax sale records under a different owner [Marion County Tax Collector](https://ctldd.com/listing_pdf/SC-Marion_County-RedeemableDeed-2015-11-02-Raw.pdf). While the McLeod and McQuilla families are established residents in the Sumter/Lee region, no specific LLC matching this hyphenated name was found in state business filings.

neighbors.name: Lee County Landfill SC, LLC
neighbors.claims: Lee County Landfill SC, LLC is a subsidiary of Republic Services, a major waste management corporation, and owns the Lee County Landfill located at 1431 Sumter Hwy [Lee County Public Works](https://www.leecountysc.org/directory/departments___elected_officials/public_works.php). The entity has demonstrated a supportive stance toward renewable energy; in 2017, the Lee County Council approved a zoning reclassification for the landfill property to facilitate a solar farm investment, a motion supported by the landfill's management [Lee County Council Minutes](https://www.leecountysc.org/county_council/council_minutes/2017_minutes.php). Furthermore, the facility hosts a renewable natural gas (RNG) plant developed in partnership with Ameresco, which began commercial operations in 2025, converting landfill gas into pipeline-quality energy [Ameresco](https://www.ameresco.com/ameresco-and-republic-services-launch-another-renewable-natural-gas-facility-at-lee-county-landfill/). The site is a significant industrial operation with established ties to county infrastructure and energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Major industrial landowner and taxpayer (Republic Services); active partner in county-level energy and infrastructure projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a strategic partner. Republic Services has a proven track record of co-locating renewable energy projects (solar and RNG) on this specific site. Highlight synergies with their existing Ameresco RNG plant and 2017 solar zoning approval.

citations.claim: owns the Lee County Landfill located at 1431 Sumter Hwy
citations.title: Lee County Public Works Directory

citations.claim: Lee County Council approved a zoning reclassification for the landfill property to facilitate a solar farm investment
citations.title: Lee County Council Regular Meeting Minutes August 8, 2017

citations.claim: hosts a renewable natural gas (RNG) plant developed in partnership with Ameresco, which began commercial operations in 2025
citations.title: Ameresco and Republic Services Launch Another Renewable Natural Gas Facility at Lee County Landfill

neighbors.name: Wateree Holdings LLC
neighbors.claims: Wateree Holdings LLC is a landholding entity managed by Forest Investment Associates (FIA), a major timberland investment management organization [York County Deeds](https://search.yorkdeeds.com/view_image.php?file=L2ltZy9zYy95b3JrLzIwMTQvMDcyNC8yMDE0MDAyNjQzNTUudGlm&type=pdf). The company holds significant timberland assets across South Carolina, including parcels in Fairfield, Dillon, and York counties, often acquired from major forestry firms like Weyerhaeuser [Fairfield County Council](https://www.fairfieldsc.com/uploads/uploads/1052015125835PM.pdf). Wateree Holdings LLC has been a recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies for conservation and commodity programs [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A12767556). The entity functions as an institutional timber investment vehicle rather than a traditional family farm.
neighbors.influence_justification: Institutional landowner (Forest Investment Associates) with significant acreage across the state; likely transactional approach to land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Forest Investment Associates (FIA) in Atlanta, GA, who manages this entity. As an institutional timber investor, they are likely familiar with solar lease structures and may be open to development if it aligns with their portfolio strategy.

citations.claim: managed by Forest Investment Associates (FIA), a major timberland investment management organization
citations.title: York County Deed Book 14260 Page 224

citations.claim: holds significant timberland assets across South Carolina, including parcels in Fairfield, Dillon, and York counties
citations.title: Fairfield County Council Agenda

citations.claim: recipient of USDA agricultural subsidies for conservation and commodity programs
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database: Wateree Holdings LLC

neighbors.name: Kelley-Hill Properties LLC
neighbors.claims: Kelley-Hill Properties LLC is a limited liability company identified as a donor to the McLeod Health Foundation in South Carolina ([McLeod Health](https://www.mcleodhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/McLeod_Foundation_2016_AR.pdf)). Public records associate the entity with individuals Amber Kelly and Tammy R. Kelly ([McLeod Health](https://www.mcleodhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/McLeod_Foundation_2016_AR.pdf)). The entity has been identified as the holder of the "Cypress Road Tract," a 64.59-acre timberland parcel in Lee County (PIN 024-00-00-167-000) ([AFM Real Estate](https://www.afmrealestate.com/properties/64.59-acres-land-for-sale-in-lee-county-south-carolina/cypress-road-tract)). Real estate listings indicate this specific tract was sold on December 1, 2025, suggesting a recent transaction of the asset ([LandWatch](https://www.landwatch.com/south-carolina-land-for-sale/lee-county/available/under-contract/sold)). The entity appears to function as a land investment vehicle or holding company.
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity is a donor to local health foundations but shows no evidence of political office or public advocacy.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the associated individuals (Amber/Tammy Kelly) acknowledging their support of local health initiatives. Given the recent sale of the Cypress Road Tract, verify current landholdings before making a formal offer.

citations.claim: Identified as a donor to the McLeod Health Foundation
citations.title: McLeod Foundation 2016 Annual Report

citations.claim: Associated with individuals Amber Kelly and Tammy R. Kelly
citations.title: McLeod Foundation 2016 Annual Report

citations.claim: Holder of the Cypress Road Tract (PIN 024-00-00-167-000)
citations.title: 64.59 Acres Land for Sale in Lee County, South Carolina

citations.claim: Tract was sold on December 1, 2025
citations.title: Lee County, South Carolina Land for Sale - Sold Listings

neighbors.name: McLeod Woodham Property LLC
neighbors.claims: The existence of a specific entity named 'McLeod Woodham Property LLC' could not be verified in South Carolina public records. The surname 'Woodham' is historically significant in Lee County, associated with the Thomas Fraser House (also known as the Woodham House) ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Fraser_House)). The name 'McLeod' is also prominent in the region, appearing in local graduations and church records ([The Miscellany](https://archives.themiscellany.org/2020/07/02/the-class-of-2020-graduates-in-style/)). The tax parcel identifier provided in the draft (025-00-00-057-000) resolves to a property in Portage County, Ohio in open datasets ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/OH/Streetsboro/1126-Gaynelle-Ave-44241/home/75392715)), indicating a probable data match error in the original draft.
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity existence cannot be confirmed; influence level is indeterminate.

approach_recommendations.engage: Do not engage until entity existence and property ownership are verified against internal county tax rolls. The current data appears to be a mismatch or hallucination.

citations.title: Thomas Fraser House - Wikipedia
